Reviews.Title: Great Monitor Screen
Reviews.Author: Scotsman
Reviews.Content: I now have 2 of these screens in use as on-podium monitor screens (I built an adjustable framework to hold the screen) taking feeds from Laptop or Video sources.  This allows the speaker to see what is on the screen(s) behind him/her without having to crane their neck to see it.  We also use it as a form of teleprompter to send a pre-written speech, so notes are not necessary.  I  have run these off both power supply and battery pack without problems.  Because they are not attached to the podiums, they do get bumped around a bit, but still work great.  If you need a good inexpensive screen, this is a great selection. Note:  It can work as a testing monitor for video signals as well.  This is helpful when you can't see the destination screen.

Reviews.Title: Great little security monitor
Reviews.Author: M. Clary "Mark"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as an in wall security monitor for my security cameras.  Works beautifully.  Only complaints are that it doesn't come with AC wall converter (its a challenge to figure out what to buy) and screen resolution is 800 x 600 max.  Tried email to vendor on converter, but they never replied.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: mike w
Reviews.Content: I use it for raspberry pi w/ analog to digital converter also a ubuntu w/ x86 VGA , works great, I modified it and changed the length of the cables and by accident broke off the ribbon holder and did some careless soldering in other places but it functions great. A 12v 1 amp powers it, although it does get warm (pwr sply) drill holes in it if u can get the enclosure apart, to let the heat escape.

Reviews.Title: Cool Monitor once power supply was found
Reviews.Author: jeff
Reviews.Content: monitor does not come with power supply; needed to buy separate power supply then do some basic wiring to get this powered up but once that was done, it's a cool little product; remote sensor needs line of sight which is not convenient for in-wall install; plenty of input options

Reviews.Title: It's pretty nice.. considering the used one i bought didn't work.
Reviews.Author: Minh "Minh"
Reviews.Content: I bought a used one.. no wonder it was only 80$.. when i tried to hook it up with my computer, it just kept saying, device not found or device not working.. so i gave up with the 10" and went to the 15".. but then i was like.. "what the heck, i'll buy a new one and see if it'll work and if not i can still return it".  Turns out.. the brand new one worked like a charm on my net book.  I've already bought now 5 of these for my booth business.they're great!  sucks that you have to buy the power and before you know it, the monitors are $160 + $18 for power and it's a $178 10" monitor!!  but it's super flat!!

Reviews.Title: Great Screen - Super Simple
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: So I bought this screen for an FPV setup for my RC car (First Person View.)I have a wireless camera setup and want to see what my camera see's when I'm driving the car.  The issue is WIRELESS has static, and as soon as there is static, the screen goes blue.  There is no way to stop the BLUE SCREEN you just have to deal with it - in my case spend $40 on gas today to buy a $35 part that still hasn't fixed it for me.Other than that, the screen is gorgeous, it comes with TWO remotes.. one is wired, the other is wireless.  Mine came with a BNC, Composite and VGA connector.  The Bezel it comes with is a solid piece of plastic, I thought it was just a frame, it's not so that's going to make it more difficult to "easily paint."Great quality picture, very bright, and other than the bluescreen issue I'm very happy with it!  You can see a video of it here:[...]

Reviews.Title: Wall Mount LCD Flat Panel Monitor w/ VGA Input
Reviews.Author: Mekra
Reviews.Content: The Wall Mount LCD Flat Panel Monitor w/VGA Input was what we needed and got just as described.  Good quality and picture.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Fit
Reviews.Author: F. Bunts
Reviews.Content: This security monitor works well and fits perfectly into the recessed space I had for it. The separate stick on frame is a great touch. You do have to supply your own plug in transformer power line. The best looking monitor I have seen.

Reviews.Title: power supply update
Reviews.Author: Nafty
Reviews.Content: Here is the power supply to be used with the moniter, http://www.amazon.com/review/r12u19iach4pbmCheck out review and there u can see the power supply. (Note I did not make the review)

Reviews.Title: I was hesitant - specific review on the 10.4 Inch model
Reviews.Author: Site Critic Today "mycview"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item for an old computer restoration project where I needed a 640x480 monitor that would work through a VGA adapter.Based on other reviews and the pictures the monitor looked like a 16:9 scale which would not have worked, but the manufacturer detail said 640x480 and 4:3 so I took a risk.Was very pleased to discover that the actual screen measures 8.5w x 6.25h which is almost perfectly 4:3Booted it up and it's gorgeous - I needed to hit the "auto-tune" to get it synced properly but after that I am very pleased.As others have mentioned make sure to buy the AC/DC convertor / adapter with this if you want to plug it in - they link to one in the description.

Reviews.Title: nice item
Reviews.Author: Juan Contreras "CCTV"
Reviews.Content: very nice item for multiple display and multiple options as vide imput, anyone in a big show room will love this units specialle with the screen protection that came with.

Reviews.Title: Appreciate the remotes, but needs power supply
Reviews.Author: Timothy English
Reviews.Content: Once installed, this monitor does the job perfectly. I appreciate the fact that they attach a wired remote, and include a wireless one since it is meant to be mounted where you won't have access to the sides or back of the unit. You do have to buy a separate power supply though. It is not ready to use right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Wrong item shipped
Reviews.Author: Julia Taylor
Reviews.Content: You are advertising one product and shipping another for the same price.  The product was advertised resolutions as 800 x 640but when we received the item it was 640 x 480.  The item was returned and I talked to a representative and he agreed to ship me the correct item.  But that did not happen, he same item was shipped for a 2nd time.  Very unhappy with the advertising and no one was able to physically walk out to the warehouse and check the item.

Reviews.Title: Does exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: HatesMalls
Reviews.Content: Some time ago I purchased an older electronic product with a tiny display.  Luckily, the product had a "VGA" output port, so I looked around for something inexpensive to use as the primary display.  Due to space limitations, I didn't want something as large as a standard 20" monitor.  I was able to find some 12" monitors but they seemed to target point of sale applications and were pretty expensive.I also saw a number of specialized video displays that did not seem to offer VGA compatibility.  I ran across the PYLE on Amazon, which was a good size and had the same aspect ratio as the original display.  I was a bit put off by the price, but purchased it anyway.Basically installation was plug and play.  I already had a 12V power supply, so connected that up and plugged in a VGA cable and everything worked.Some complaints:1)  I read the documentation before purchase and could not determine many details of operation.  For example:  do you have to do setup every time you turn it on?  Often things that aren't spelled out aren't there.  Fortunately, setup with the Pyle was easy and it does remember everything.2)  It is not the easiest thing to mount.  More mounting options (brackets and or holes) would be a help.  I only remember four mounting holes.3)  It wasn't clear before purchase, but all of the input cables and the remote control cable are hardwired to the circuit board.  On something as expensive as this you would expect connectors so unnecessary cables could be easily removed.  I currently have all the unneeded cables strapped to the back of the display - an unsightly mess.In summary the PYLE did exactly what I wanted, but I can't speak about the color fidelity, crispness or other aspects of video quality.  I think it is a bit overpriced, but this isn't a mass-market item, so some additional cost is expected.

Reviews.Title: No power adapter
Reviews.Author: Andy k. Chan
Reviews.Content: When it came, it looked good.  However, when installing it, found out no power adapter. I had to look for adapter to connect with the two tiny wires.  I will reconsider of purchasing this brand.

Reviews.Title: okay
Reviews.Author: johnny c
Reviews.Content: i bought this to relace my monitor for a front door camerra it looked great, but one of the inputs did'nt work, and it so happens the i needed not LOL......i had to return it and bought an owl cctv monitor,,,,i went cheap and paid for it lost all shipping costs, the owl 8inch monitor came out of the box ( plug and paly)...thankx for this but not pyle monitor

Reviews.Title: Worked Great
Reviews.Author: tina
Reviews.Content: The monitor worked great for what my company used it for, the graphics in it was great and our customer was varry happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Did not have 800x600 resolution as advertised
Reviews.Author: Arthur Zatarain "Artzat"
Reviews.Content: The LCD display is advertised on Amazon and the Pyle website as having 800x600 resolution, or 800x640 resolution. The unit that I received was marked 640x480 on the box exterior as well as in the enclosed instructions. Perhaps there are two versions of the same model number, and I received some old stock. I contacted Pyle several times via email for clarification but did not receive a response. I did not bother to test the unit. It was returned to Amazon, and my cost was promptly refunded

Reviews.Title: No Power
Reviews.Author: Earl English
Reviews.Content: All the available power supplies that are supposed to work with this monitor have an interface that requires a round plug for connection. This monitor comes with bare wires that come out of a little black box connected to the set of cables coming out of the monitor.I tried to contact one of the companies that sell the power supplies, but they would not return any of my emails.Since I was unable to purchase a power supply that will connect with this monitor, I have not been able to power it on.I think that including a power supply that works would be important for people who want to purchase this product.
